newsitem.title: FINLAND: Kemira sells rest of Vihtavuori to state.
newsitem.headline: Kemira sells rest of Vihtavuori to state.

text.p: Finnish chemicals and fertiliser group Kemira Oy said in a statement on Tuesday it had sold its remaining 49.9 percent holding in Vihtavuori Oy to the state for an undisclosed sum.
Kemira last year sold 51.1 percent of the company to the state.

Since last year's deal included the option to sell the rest, Kemira had booked the whole disposal in last year's accounts and the impact was "not significant," vice president Timo Mattila told Reuters but declined to elaborate.

For the government, the purchase of gunpowder and exlosives maker Vihtavuori was part of concentrating the state-owned arms industry and for Kemira it meant a continued focus on core businesses, Kemira said.
